intro: Agrostemma alpinum, commonly known as the alpine grassbladder, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Agrostemma alpinum is often found in alpine meadows and is considered a rare and delicate species due to its specific habitat requirements.
